sen.j: 天児屋命（あめのこやねのみこと）は、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)。
sen.e: Amenokoyane no Mikoto (written in kanji as 天児屋命) is a deity (shindo, or god of heaven and earth) that appeared in Japanese mythology.
sen.cmt: 神道(しんどう)は神祇のことであると解釈しました(広辞苑を参照)。
sen.e: Amenokoyane no Mikoto (written in kanji as 天児屋命) is a deity (shindo, or god of heaven and earth) that appeared in Japanese mythology.
Amenokoyane no Mikoto (written in kanji as 天児屋命) is a god (Shinto) that appeared in Japanese mythology.

sen.j: 神社の祭神としては天児屋根命とも表記される。
sen.e: It is also written as 天児屋根命 when it refers to an enshrined deity in a shrine.
It is also written as 天児屋根命 when it refers to an enshrined deity in a shrine.
It is also written as 天児屋根命 when it refers to an enshrined deity in a shrine.

sen.j: 春日権現（かすがごんげん）とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: It is also called Kasuga Gongen.
It is also called Kasuga Gongen.
It is also called Kasuga Gongen.

sen.j: 妻は天美津玉照比売命（あめのみつたまてるひめのみこと）。
sen.e: His wife was Amenomitsutamateruhime no mikoto.
His wife was Amenomitsutamateruhime no mikoto.
His wife was Amenomitsutamateruhime no Mikoto.
sen.cmt: 神名表現を統一しました。

sen.e: A child of 居々登魂命.
A child of 居々登魂命.
A child of 居々登魂命.

sen.j: 岩戸隠れの際、岩戸の前で祝詞を唱えた。
sen.e: During Iwato-gakure (the hiding of Amaterasu Omikami, the sun goddess, in the heavenly rock cave), he sang norito (Shinto prayer) in front of the rock cave.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During Iwato-gakure (the hiding of Amaterasu Omikami, the sun goddess, in the heavenly rock cave), he sang norito (Shinto prayer) in front of the rock cave.
During Iwato-gakure (the hiding of Amaterasu Omikami, the sun goddess, in the heavenly rock cave), he sang norito (Shinto prayer) in front of the rock cave.

sen.j: 天照大神が岩戸を少し開いたときにフトダマとともに鏡を差し出した。
sen.e: When Amaterasu Omikami slightly opened the cave, he and Futodama showed her a mirror.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Amaterasu Omikami slightly opened the cave, he and Futodama showed her a mirror.
When Amaterasu Omikami slightly opened the cave, he and Futodama showed her a mirror.

sen.j: 天孫降臨の際ニニギに随伴し、中臣氏などの祖となったとされる。
sen.e: He accompanied Ninigi during tensonkorin (the descent to earth of Ninigi, the grandson of the sun goddess), and became the patriarch of Nakatomi clan.
sen.cmt: 用語集より採用した「天孫降臨」の括弧内の説明文に、天照大神の孫であることがわかるようにニニギの名を加えました。
sen.e: He accompanied Ninigi during tensonkorin (the descent to earth of Ninigi, the grandson of the sun goddess), and became the patriarch of Nakatomi clan.
He accompanied Ninigi during tensonkorin (the descent to earth of Ninigi, the grandson of the sun goddess), and became the patriarch of Nakatomi clan.

sen.j: 名前の「コヤネ」は「小さな屋根（の建物）」の意味で、託宣の神の居所のことと考えられる。
sen.e: A part of his name 'koyane' means 'a small roof (of a building)', therefore it is thought to be the location of a deity who gives an oracle.
A part of his name 'koyane' means 'a small roof (of a building)', therefore it is thought to be the location of a deity who gives an oracle.
A part of his name 'koyane' means 'a small roof (of a building)', therefore it is thought to be the location of a deity who gives an oracle.

sen.j: 中臣連の祖神であることから、藤原鎌足を祖とする藤原氏の氏神として信仰された。
sen.e: Because he was a soshin (ancestor honored as god) of Nakatomi no muraji, he was believed as a private deity of Fujiwara clan whose patriarch was FUJIWARA no Kamatari.
sen.cmt: 用語集で「中臣連」はNakatomi-no-murajiと登録されていましたが、訳文ではハイフンを使用しませんでした。
sen.e: Because he was a soshin (ancestor honored as god) of Nakatomi no muraji, he was believed to be a private deity of the Fujiwara clan whose patriarch was FUJIWARA no Kamatari.
Because he was a soshin (ancestor honored as god) of Nakatomi no muraji, he was believed to be a private deity of the Fujiwara clan whose patriarch was FUJIWARA no Kamatari.

sen.j: 祝詞の神、出世の神ともされる。
sen.e: He was also a deity of norito and career success.
He was also a deity of norito and career success.
He was also a god of norito and career success.
sen.cmt: deity →god として統一しました。

sen.j: 中臣神社（京都市山科区）、枚岡神社（大阪府東大阪市）、春日大社（奈良県奈良市）、吉田神社（京都市左京区）などに祀られている。
sen.e: He was enshrined in Nakatomi-jinja Shrine (Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City), Hiraoka-jinja Shrine (Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture), Kasugataisha Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture), and Yoshida-jinja Shrine (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).

He was enshrined in Nakatomi-jinja Shrine (Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City), Hiraoka-jinja Shrine (Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture), Kasugataisha Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture), and Yoshida-jinja Shrine (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).

He was enshrined in Nakatomi-jinja Shrine (Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City), Hiraoka-jinja Shrine (Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture), Kasuga-taisha Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture), and Yoshida-jinja Shrine (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: また、全国の大鳥神社に祀られる「大鳥連祖神（おおとりのむらじのおやがみ）」は天児屋命と同神とされることがある。
sen.e: Otorinomuraji-no-oyagami' that is enshrined in Otori-jinja Shrine throughout the country is sometimes considered to be identical to Amenokoyane no Mikoto.
Otorinomuraji-no-oyagami' that is enshrined in Otori-jinja Shrine throughout the country is sometimes considered to be identical to Amenokoyane no Mikoto.
A god called 'Otorinomuraji no Oyagami' that is enshrined in Otori-jinja Shrine throughout the country is sometimes considered to be identical to Amenokoyane no Mikoto.
sen.cmt: 神名表現を統一しました。

sen.j: また、江戸後期の国学者・平田篤胤の説では、この神はオモイカネと同一神であるとしている。
sen.e: According to a scholar of Japanese classical literature in late Edo period, Atsutane HIRATA, this deity is identical to Omoikane (the god of wisdom and talent).
According to a scholar of Japanese classical literature in late Edo period, Atsutane HIRATA, this deity is identical to Omoikane (the god of wisdom and talent).
According to a scholar of Japanese classical literature in late Edo period, Atsutane HIRATA, this god is identical to Omoikane (the god of wisdom and talent).
sen.cmt: deity →god として統一しました。
